task_list.name: Measure Features
task_list.docs_info:
### Purpose
- Calculates **morphology**, **intensity**, **texture**, and **population features** for objects in a label image.
- Supports **2D and 3D measurements** across multiple regions of interest (ROIs).
- Extracts features for intensity images using configurable channel inclusion/exclusion.

### Outputs
- A **feature table** saved in the OME-Zarr structure, containing:
  - Morphology features (e.g., size, shape, well coordinates).
  - Intensity features (e.g., mean, max, min intensity per object).
  - Texture features (e.g., Haralick, Laws' texture energy).
  - Population features (e.g., densities and number of neighbours).
- Updated ROI metadata with border and well location information.

### Limitations
- Does not support measurements for label images that do not have the same resolution as the intensity images.

ChannelInputModel.description: A channel which is specified by either `wavelength_id` or `label`.

wavelength_id.title: Wavelength Id
wavelength_id.description: Unique ID for the channel wavelength, e.g. `A01_C01`. Can only be specified if label is not set.

label.title: Label
label.description: Name of the channel. Can only be specified if wavelength_id is not set.

ChannelInputModel.title: ChannelInputModel

TextureFeatures.description: Validator to handle texture feature selection.

haralick.title: Haralick
haralick.description: Flag to calculate Haralick texture features.

laws_texture_energy.title: Laws Texture Energy
laws_texture_energy.description: Flag to calculate Law's Texture Energy features.

clip_value.title: Clip Value
clip_value.description: Value to which to clip the intensity image for haralick texture feature calculation. Will be applied to all channels except the ones specified in clip_value_exceptions.

clip_value_exceptions.title: Clip Value Exceptions
clip_value_exceptions.description: Dictionary of exceptions for the clip value. The dictionary should have the channel name as key and the clip value as value.

TextureFeatures.title: TextureFeatures

zarr_url.title: Zarr Url
zarr_url.description: Path or url to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

label_image_name.title: Label Image Name
label_image_name.description: Name of the label image that contains the seeds. Needs to exist in OME-Zarr file. ROI_table_name: Name of the ROI table to process. output_table_name: Name of the feature table.

channels_to_include.title: Channels To Include
channels_to_include.description: List of channels to include for intensity and texture measurements. Use the channel label to indicate single channels. If None, all channels are included.

channels_to_exclude.title: Channels To Exclude
channels_to_exclude.description: List of channels to exclude for intensity and texture measurements. Use the channel label to indicate single channels. If None, no channels are excluded.

measure_texture.title: Measure Texture
measure_texture.description: Select which texture features should be calculated.

calculate_internal_borders.title: Calculate Internal Borders
calculate_internal_borders.description: For a typical experiment this should not be selected. If True, calculate internal borders (whether an object touches or overlaps with a FOV border). This is only useful if you registered by well and want to remove objects that are on the border of a FOV. IMPORTANT: This only catches objects that are on the border of FOVs in cycle 1 of a multiplexed experiment.

level.title: Level
level.description: Resolution of the label image to calculate features. Only tested for level 0.

overwrite.title: Overwrite
overwrite.description: If True, overwrite existing feature table.

task_list.name: Calculate Pixel Intensity Correlation
task_list.docs_info:
### Purpose
- Calculates pixel intensity correlation between two channels for each object in a label image.  
- Supports loading channels from different multiplexing acquisitions.  
- Handles multiple channel pairs per well and large datasets efficiently.  

### Outputs
- A **feature table** in the OME-Zarr structure with correlation values for specified channel pairs for each object.  

### Limitations
- Requires consistent **label and channel names** across input zarrs.  
- Assumes NGFF-compatible metadata.  
- Only validated for **level 0 resolution**.

InitArgsCalculatePixelIntensityCorrelati.description: Calculate Pixel Intensity Correlation init args.
InitArgsCalculatePixelIntensityCorrelati.title: InitArgsCalculatePixelIntensityCorrelation

zarr_url.title: Zarr Url
zarr_url.description: Path or url to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

ROI_table_name.title: Roi Table Name
ROI_table_name.description: Name of the table containing the ROIs.

output_table_name.title: Output Table Name
output_table_name.description: Name of the output feature table.

level.title: Level
level.description: Resolution of the label image to calculate correlation. Only tested for level 0.

task_list.name: Segment Secondary Objects
task_list.docs_info:
### Purpose
- Segments secondary objects based on primary labels and intensity images using watershed segmentation.  
- Supports multiplexed and non-multiplexed acquisitions.  
- Optional parameters allow for flexible handling of thresholds, blurring, and masking.  

### Limitations
- Requires consistent **label and channel names** across input zarrs.  
- Assumes NGFF-compatible metadata.  
- Only tested for **level 0 resolution**.

zarr_urls.title: Zarr Urls
zarr_urls.description: List of paths or urls to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

zarr_dir.title: Zarr Dir
zarr_dir.description: path of the directory where the new OME-Zarrs will be created. Not used by this task. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

channel_label.description: Label of the intensity image used for watershed. Needs to exist in OME-Zarr file.

label_name.title: Label Name
label_name.description: Name of the label image that contains the seeds. Needs to exist in OME-Zarr file.

mask.title: Mask
mask.description: label image to use as mask. Only areas where the mask is non-zero will be considered for the watershed.

output_label_image_name.title: Output Label Image Name
output_label_image_name.description: Name of the zarr image that will contain the secondary segmentation. Defaults to "0". In case you saved, for example, illumination corrected images in the same zarr without overwriting the original images, you can specify a different name here (e.g. "0_illum_corrected").

ROI_table_name.description: Name of the table containing the ROIs.

max_threshold.description: Maximum threshold for the background definition.

fill_holes_area.title: Fill Holes Area
fill_holes_area.description: Area threshold for filling holes after watershed.

output_label_name.title: Output Label Name
output_label_name.description: Name of the output label image.

task_list.docs_info:
## init_expand_labels
Initialized secondary segmentation task

This task prepares a parallelization list of all zarr_urls that need to be
used to perform expansion of a label image.
## expand_labels_skimage
Expands labels in a label image by "distance" pixels without overlapping.

Takes a primary label image and expands it by a certain distance. Direct
implementation of skimage.segmentation.expand_labels.

task_list.name: Convert IC6000 to OME-Zarr

MultiplexingAcquisition.description: Input class for Multiplexing Cellvoyager converter

image_dir.title: Image Dir
image_dir.description: Path to the folder that contains the Cellvoyager image files for that acquisition and the MeasurementData & MeasurementDetail metadata files.

allowed_channels.title: Allowed Channels
allowed_channels.description: A list of `OmeroChannel` objects, where each channel must include the `wavelength_id` attribute and where the `wavelength_id` values must be unique across the list.

MultiplexingAcquisition.title: MultiplexingAcquisition

OmeroChannel.description: Custom class for Omero channels, based on OME-NGFF v0.4.

wavelength_id.title: Wavelength Id
wavelength_id.description: Unique ID for the channel wavelength, e.g. `A01_C01`.

index.title: Index
index.description: Do not change. For internal use only.

window.title: Window
window.description: Optional `Window` object to set default display settings for napari.

color.title: Color
color.description: Optional hex colormap to display the channel in napari (it must be of length 6, e.g. `00FFFF`).

active.title: Active
active.description: Should this channel be shown in the viewer?

OmeroChannel.title: OmeroChannel

Window.description: Custom class for Omero-channel window, based on OME-NGFF v0.4.

min.title: Min
min.description: Do not change. It will be set to `0` by default.

max.title: Max
max.description: Do not change. It will be set according to bit-depth of the images by default (e.g. 65535 for 16 bit images).

Window.title: Window

acquisitions.title: Acquisitions
acquisitions.description: dictionary of acquisitions. Each key is the acquisition identifier (normally 0, 1, 2, 3 etc.). Each item defines the acquisition by providing the image_dir and the allowed_channels.

image_glob_patterns.title: Image Glob Patterns
image_glob_patterns.description: If specified, only parse images with filenames that match with all these patterns. Patterns must be defined as in https://docs.python.org/3/library/fnmatch.html, Example: `image_glob_pattern=["*B - 03*"]` => only process well B03 `image_glob_pattern=["*C - 09*", "*fld 16*"]` => only process well C09, field of view 16.

num_levels.title: Num Levels
num_levels.description: Number of resolution-pyramid levels. If set to `5`, there will be the full-resolution level and 4 levels of downsampled images.

coarsening_xy.title: Coarsening Xy
coarsening_xy.description: Linear coarsening factor between subsequent levels. If set to `2`, level 1 is 2x downsampled, level 2 is 4x downsampled etc.

InitArgsIC6000.description: Arguments to be passed from IC6000 converter init to compute
InitArgsIC6000.title: InitArgsIC6000

zarr_url.title: Zarr Url
zarr_url.description: Path or url to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

task_list.docs_info:
## init_convert_IC6000_to_ome_zarr
Create OME-NGFF structure and metadata to host a multiplexing dataset.

This task takes a set of image folders (i.e. different acquisition cycles)
and build the internal structure and metadata of a OME-NGFF zarr group,
without actually loading/writing the image data.

Each element in input_paths should be treated as a different acquisition.
## convert_IC6000_to_ome_zarr
Convert IC6000 output (png, tif) to zarr file.

This task is run after "init_convert_IC6000_to_ome_zarr"
and populates the empty OME-Zarr files that were prepared.

zarr_urls.title: Zarr Urls
zarr_urls.description: List of paths or urls to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server). zarr_dir: path of the directory where the new OME-Zarrs will be created. Not used by this task. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server). acquisitions: dictionary of acquisitions. Each key is the acquisition identifier (normally 0, 1, 2, 3 etc.). Each item defines the acquisition by providing the image_dir and the allowed_channels. zarr_path: Path to the zarr file to which to add multiplexing cycles. image_glob_patterns: If specified, only parse images with filenames that match with all these patterns. Patterns must be defined as in https://docs.python.org/3/library/fnmatch.html, Example: `image_glob_pattern=["*B - 03*"]` => only process well B03 `image_glob_pattern=["*C - 09*", "*fld 16*"]` => only process well C09, field of view 16. num_levels: Number of resolution-pyramid levels. If set to `5`, there will be the full-resolution level and 4 levels of downsampled images. coarsening_xy: Linear coarsening factor between subsequent levels. If set to `2`, level 1 is 2x downsampled, level 2 is 4x downsampled etc. image_extension: Filename extension of images (e.g. `"tif"` or `"png"`). overwrite: If `True`, overwrite the task output.

InitArgsIC6000.description: Arguments to be passed from IC6000 converter init to compute
InitArgsIC6000.title: InitArgsIC6000

zarr_url.title: Zarr Url
zarr_url.description: Path or url to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

task_list.docs_info:
## init_add_multiplexing_cycle_IC6000
Create OME-NGFF structure and metadata to host a multiplexing dataset.

This task takes an existing zarr file and a set of image folders
(i.e. different acquisition cycles) and builds the internal structure and
metadata of a OME-NGFF zarr group, without actually loading/writing the
 image data.

Each element in input_paths should be treated as a different acquisition.
## convert_IC6000_to_ome_zarr
Convert IC6000 output (png, tif) to zarr file.

This task is run after "init_convert_IC6000_to_ome_zarr"
and populates the empty OME-Zarr files that were prepared.

task_list.name: Label Assignment by Overlap

zarr_urls.title: Zarr Urls
zarr_urls.description: List of paths or urls to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

zarr_dir.title: Zarr Dir
zarr_dir.description: path of the directory where the new OME-Zarrs will be created. Not used by this task. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

child_label_name.title: Child Label Name
child_label_name.description: Name of the child label. This label will be assigned to the parent label based on overlap. The parent label will appear in the child feature table as the "(parent_label_name)_label" column in the obs table of the anndata table.

InitArgsLabelAssignment.description: Arguments to be passed from Label Assignment init to compute
InitArgsLabelAssignment.title: InitArgsLabelAssignment

zarr_url.title: Zarr Url
zarr_url.description: Path or url to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

child_table_name.title: Child Table Name
child_table_name.description: Name of the feature table associated with the child label image.

level.title: Level
level.description: Resolution of the label image to calculate overlap. Only tested for level 0.

overlap_threshold.title: Overlap Threshold
overlap_threshold.description: The minimum percentage (between 0 and 1) of child label object that must be contained in parent label object to be considered a match.

task_list.docs_info:
## init_label_assignment_by_overlap
Initialized label assignment by overlap task

This task prepares a parallelization list of all zarr_urls that need to be
used to perform label assignment based on overlap between two label images.
## label_assignment_by_overlap
Assign labels to each other based on overlap.

Takes a parent label image and a child label image and calculates
overlaps between their labels. Child labels will be assigned to parent
labels based on an overlap threshold.

task_list.name: Clip Label Image

zarr_urls.title: Zarr Urls
zarr_urls.description: List of paths or urls to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

zarr_dir.title: Zarr Dir
zarr_dir.description: path of the directory where the new OME-Zarrs will be created. Not used by this task. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

label_name.title: Label Name
label_name.description: Name of the label image to be clipped. Needs to exist in OME-Zarr file.

clipping_mask_name.title: Clipping Mask Name
clipping_mask_name.description: Name of the label image used as mask for clipping. This image will be binarized. Needs to exist in OME-Zarr file.

output_label_image_name.title: Output Label Image Name
output_label_image_name.description: Name of the zarr image that will contain the clipped label image. Defaults to "0". In case you saved, for example, illumination corrected images in the same zarr without overwriting the original images, you can specify a different name here (e.g. "0_illum_corrected").

InitArgsClipLabelImage.description: Arguments to be passed from Clip Label Image init to compute
InitArgsClipLabelImage.title: InitArgsClipLabelImage

zarr_url.title: Zarr Url
zarr_url.description: Path or url to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

output_label_name.title: Output Label Name
output_label_name.description: Name of the output label image.

level.title: Level
level.description: Resolution of the label image. Only tested for level 0.

overwrite.title: Overwrite
overwrite.description: If True, overwrite existing label image.

task_list.docs_info:
## init_clip_label_image
Initialized clip label image task

This task prepares a parallelization list of all zarr_urls that need to be
used to perform clipping based on two label images.
## clip_label_image
Clips a label image with a mask.

Takes two label images (or a label image and a binary mask) and replaces
all values in the first label image with 0 where the second label image has
values > 0.

## init_mask_label_image
Initialized apply mask task

This task prepares a parallelization list of all zarr_urls that need to be
used to perform mask application based on two label images.
## mask_label_image
Applies a mask to a label image.

Takes two label images (or a label image and a binary mask) and replaces
all values in the first label image with 0 where the second label image has
values = 0.

task_list.name: Calculate BaSiCPy Illumination Models

zarr_urls.title: Zarr Urls
zarr_urls.description: List of paths or urls to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

zarr_dir.title: Zarr Dir
zarr_dir.description: path of the directory where the new OME-Zarrs will be created. Not used by this task. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

n_images.title: N Images
n_images.description: Number of images to use to calculate BaSiCPy model.

correct_by.title: Correct By
correct_by.description: Defines how illumination correction will be calculated. - channel label: illumination correction will be calculated per channel label - wavelength id: illumination correction will be calculated per wavelength id

compute_per_well.title: Compute Per Well
compute_per_well.description: If True, calculate illumination profiles per well. This can be useful if your experiment contains different stainings in each well (e.g., different antibodies with varying intensity ranges). Defaults to False.

exclude_border_FOVs.title: Exclude Border Fovs
exclude_border_FOVs.description: If True, exclude border FOVs from the calculation. Useful if the whole well was imaged and the border FOVs have some artifacts.

BaSiCPyModelParams.description: Advanced parameters for BaSiCPy illumination correction.

autosegment.title: Autosegment
autosegment.description: When not False, automatically segment the image before fitting.When True, threshold_otsu from scikit-image is used and the brighter pixels are taken.When a callable is given, it is used as the segmentation function.

autosegment_margin.title: Autosegment Margin
autosegment_margin.description: Margin of the segmentation mask to the thresholded region.

get_darkfield.title: Get Darkfield
get_darkfield.description: When True, will estimate the darkfield shading component.

max_iterations.title: Max Iterations
max_iterations.description: Maximum number of iterations for single optimization.

max_mu_coef.title: Max Mu Coef
max_mu_coef.description: Maximum allowed value of mu, divided by the initial value.

max_reweight_iterations_baseline.title: Max Reweight Iterations Baseline
max_reweight_iterations_baseline.description: Maximum number of reweighting iterations for baseline.

max_workers.title: Max Workers
max_workers.description: Maximum number of threads used for processing.

resize_mode.title: Resize Mode
resize_mode.description: Resize mode to use when downsampling images. Must be one of ‘jax’, ‘skimage’, and ‘skimage_dask’

reweighting_tol.title: Reweighting Tol
reweighting_tol.description: Reweighting tolerance in mean absolute difference of images.

smoothness_darkfield.title: Smoothness Darkfield
smoothness_darkfield.description: Weight of the darkfield term in the Lagrangian.

smoothness_flatfield.title: Smoothness Flatfield
smoothness_flatfield.description: Weight of the flatfield term in the Lagrangian.

sort_intensity.title: Sort Intensity
sort_intensity.description: Whether or not to sort the intensities of the image.

sparse_cost_darkfield.title: Sparse Cost Darkfield
sparse_cost_darkfield.description: Size for running computations. None means no rescaling.

BaSiCPyModelParams.title: BaSiCPyModelParams

InitArgsBaSiCPyCalculate.description: Arguments to be passed from BaSiCPy Calculate init to compute
InitArgsBaSiCPyCalculate.title: InitArgsBaSiCPyCalculate

zarr_url.title: Zarr Url
zarr_url.description: Path or url to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

illumination_profiles_folder.title: Illumination Profiles Folder
illumination_profiles_folder.description: Path to folder where illumination profiles will be saved.

advanced_basicpy_model_params.title: Advanced Basicpy Model Params
advanced_basicpy_model_params.description: Advanced parameters for the BaSiC model.

overwrite.title: Overwrite
overwrite.description: If True, overwrite existing illumination profiles.

task_list.docs_info:
## init_calculate_basicpy_illumination_models
Initialized BaSiCPy illumination correction task

This task prepares a parallelization list of all zarr_urls that need to be
used to perform illumination correction with BaSiCPy.
## calculate_basicpy_illumination_models
Calculates illumination correction profiles based on a random sample
of images for each channel_label or wavelength.

task_list.name: Apply BaSiCPy Illumination Models

zarr_url.title: Zarr Url
zarr_url.description: Path or url to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

illumination_profiles_folder.title: Illumination Profiles Folder
illumination_profiles_folder.description: Path of folder of illumination profiles.

correct_by.title: Correct By
correct_by.description: Defines how illumination correction has been calculated. - channel label: illumination correction has been calculated per channel label - wavelength id: illumination correction has been calculated per wavelength id

illumination_exceptions.title: Illumination Exceptions
illumination_exceptions.description: List of channel labels or wavelength ids that should not be corrected.

darkfield.title: Darkfield
darkfield.description: If `True`, darkfield correction will be performed.

subtract_baseline.title: Subtract Baseline
subtract_baseline.description: If `True`, baseline subtraction will be performed.

fixed_baseline.title: Fixed Baseline
fixed_baseline.description: Set a value if you want to subtract a fixed baseline (e.g., 100). If `None` and subtract baseline is 'True', the median of the basicpy baseline will be used.

input_ROI_table.title: Input Roi Table
input_ROI_table.description: Name of the ROI table that contains the information about the location of the individual field of views (FOVs) to which the illumination correction shall be applied. Defaults to "FOV_ROI_table", the default name Fractal converters give the ROI tables that list all FOVs separately. If you generated your OME-Zarr with a different converter and used Import OME-Zarr to generate the ROI tables, `image_ROI_table` is the right choice if you only have 1 FOV per Zarr image and `grid_ROI_table` if you have multiple FOVs per Zarr image and set the right grid options during import.

overwrite_input.title: Overwrite Input
overwrite_input.description: If `True`, the results of this task will overwrite the input image data. If false, a new image is generated and the illumination corrected data is saved there.

suffix.title: Suffix
suffix.description: What suffix to append to the illumination corrected images. Only relevant if `overwrite_input=False`.

task_list.docs_info:
## apply_basicpy_illumination_models
Applies illumination correction to the images in the OME-Zarr.

task_list.name: Aggregate Feature Tables

zarr_urls.title: Zarr Urls
zarr_urls.description: List of paths or urls to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

zarr_dir.title: Zarr Dir
zarr_dir.description: path of the directory where the new OME-Zarrs will be created. Not used by this task. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

InitArgsAggregateFeatureTables.description: Arguments to be passed from BaSiCPy Calculate init to compute
InitArgsAggregateFeatureTables.title: InitArgsAggregateFeatureTables

zarr_url.title: Zarr Url
zarr_url.description: Missing description

output_table_name.title: Output Table Name
output_table_name.description: Name of the aggregated feature table. If this is the same as the input_table_name, the input table will be overwritten.

output_image.title: Output Image
output_image.description: In which zarr-image to store the aggregated feature table. By default, it is saved in the first image of the zarr. If output_table_name is the same as input_table_name, the table will be overwritten in the same image.

overwrite.title: Overwrite
overwrite.description: If True, overwrite existing feature table.

task_list.docs_info:
## init_aggregate_feature_tables
Initialized clip label image task

This task prepares a parallelization list of all zarr_urls that need to be
used to perform clipping based on two label images.
## aggregate_feature_tables
Aggregate feature tables that were calculated per zarr-image to one
Anndata table containing feature measurements across all zarr-images.

task_list.name: Stitch FOVs with Overlap

zarr_url.title: Zarr Url
zarr_url.description: Path or url to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

overlap.title: Overlap
overlap.description: The overlap between FOVs in percent (0-1).

filter_sigma.title: Filter Sigma
filter_sigma.description: The sigma of the Gaussian filter used to filter the FOVs for stitching. Can help to improve the stitching performance.

overwrite_input.title: Overwrite Input
overwrite_input.description: If `True`, the results of this task will overwrite the input image data. If false, a new image is generated and the stitched data is saved there.

suffix.title: Suffix
suffix.description: What suffix to append to the stitched images. Only relevant if `overwrite_input=False`.

tmp_dir.title: Tmp Dir
tmp_dir.description: Optional path to where the temporary directory should be created. Might be necessary if the default temporary directory (/tmp/) on the cluster has too little space left.

task_list.docs_info:
## stitch_fovs_with_overlap
Stitches FOVs with overlap using ASHLAR (https://github.com/labsyspharm/ashlar).

task_list.name: Multiplexed Pixel Clustering

zarr_urls.title: Zarr Urls
zarr_urls.description: List of paths or urls to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

zarr_dir.title: Zarr Dir
zarr_dir.description: path of the directory where the new OME-Zarrs will be created. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

label_image_name.title: Label Image Name
label_image_name.description: Name of label image to use. Only pixels that are part of a label will be considered for clustering.

channels_to_use.title: Channels To Use
channels_to_use.description: List of channel labels to use for clustering. If None, all channels are used.

channels_to_exclude.title: Channels To Exclude
channels_to_exclude.description: List of channel labels to exclude from clustering. If None, no channels are excluded.

som_shape.title: Som Shape
som_shape.description: Shape of the self-organizing map (SOM) to use for clustering.

phenograph_neighbours.title: Phenograph Neighbours
phenograph_neighbours.description: Number of nearest neighbors to use in first step of graph construction.

enforce_equal_object_count.title: Enforce Equal Object Count
enforce_equal_object_count.description: If True, the same number of objects from the label images will be used to extract pixels for clustering.

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: Random seed for selection of objects if enforce_equal_object_count is True.

coords.title: Coords
coords.description: Image coordinates to use. If None, the whole well will be used. Format: [y_start, y_end, x_start, x_end].

output_label_name.title: Output Label Name
output_label_name.description: Name of the output label image which will map the multiplexed pixel clusters

overwrite.title: Overwrite
overwrite.description: If True, overwrite existing output table.

task_list.docs_info:
## multiplexed_pixel_clustering
Perform multiplexed cell unit (MCU) analysis on a label image. Inspired by
Gabriele Gut et al., Multiplexed protein maps link subcellular
organization to cellular states. Science (2018)
DOI: 10.1126/science.aar7042

task_list.name: Correct Chromatic Shift

zarr_urls.title: Zarr Urls
zarr_urls.description: List of paths or urls to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

zarr_dir.title: Zarr Dir
zarr_dir.description: path of the directory where the new OME-Zarrs will be created. Not used by this task. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

reference_zarr_image.title: Reference Zarr Image
reference_zarr_image.description: Path to the reference zarr image used for chromatic shift correction. Needs to exist in OME-Zarr file.

reference_channel_label.title: Reference Channel Label
reference_channel_label.description: Label of the channel in the reference zarr image to which the other channels will be corrected.

InitArgsCorrectChromaticShift.description: Arguments to be passed from Correct Chromatic Shift init to compute
InitArgsCorrectChromaticShift.title: InitArgsCorrectChromaticShift

zarr_url.title: Zarr Url
zarr_url.description: Path or url to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

overwrite_input.title: Overwrite Input
overwrite_input.description: If `True`, the results of this task will overwrite the input image data. If false, a new image is generated and the chromatic shift corrected data is saved there.

suffix.title: Suffix
suffix.description: What suffix to append to the illumination corrected images. Only relevant if `overwrite_input=False`.

task_list.docs_info:
## init_correct_chromatic_shift
Initialized Correct Chromatic Shift task

This task prepares a parallelization list of all zarr_urls that need to be
used to perform chromatic shift correction based on reference images of
(for example) fluorescent beads.
## correct_chromatic_shift
Correct chromatic shift based on reference images (for example fluorescent
beads) and apply it to all images.

task_list.name: Convert Channel to Label

zarr_urls.title: Zarr Urls
zarr_urls.description: List of paths or urls to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

zarr_dir.title: Zarr Dir
zarr_dir.description: path of the directory where the new OME-Zarrs will be created. Not used by this task. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

channel_label.title: Channel Label
channel_label.description: Label of the channel that will be converted to a label.

output_label_image_name.title: Output Label Image Name
output_label_image_name.description: Name of the zarr image that will contain the converted label image. Defaults to "0". In case you saved, for example, illumination corrected images in the same zarr without overwriting the original images, you can specify a different name here (e.g. "0_illum_corrected").

InitArgsConvertChannelToLabel.description: Arguments to be passed from Convert Channel to Label init to compute
InitArgsConvertChannelToLabel.title: InitArgsConvertChannelToLabel

zarr_url.title: Zarr Url
zarr_url.description: Missing description

task_list.docs_info:
## init_convert_channel_to_label
Initialized Filter Label by Size task

This task prepares a parallelization list of all zarr_urls that need to be
used to perform Convert Channel to Label task.
## convert_channel_to_label
Convert a channel of an OME-Zarr image to a label image.

Args:
    zarr_url: Path or url to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed.
        (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).
    init_args: Intialization arguments provided by
    `init_convert_channel_to_label`.
    output_label_name: Name of the label to be created.
    overwrite: If True, overwrite existing label image with same name.

task_list.name: Detect Blob Centroids

zarr_urls.title: Zarr Urls
zarr_urls.description: List of paths or urls to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

zarr_dir.title: Zarr Dir
zarr_dir.description: path of the directory where the new OME-Zarrs will be created. Not used by this task. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

channel_label.title: Channel Label
channel_label.description: Label of the channel in which blobs will be detected.

output_label_image_name.title: Output Label Image Name
output_label_image_name.description: Name of the zarr image that will contain the label image with detected blob centroids. Defaults to "0". In case you saved, for example, illumination corrected images in the same zarr without overwriting the original images, you can specify a different name here (e.g. "0_illum_corrected").

InitArgsDetectBlobCentroids.description: Arguments to be passed from Convert Channel to Label init to compute
InitArgsDetectBlobCentroids.title: InitArgsDetectBlobCentroids

zarr_url.title: Zarr Url
zarr_url.description: Path or url to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

ROI_table_name.title: Roi Table Name
ROI_table_name.description: Name of the table containing the ROIs.

output_label_name.title: Output Label Name
output_label_name.description: Name of the output label image.

level.title: Level
level.description: Resolution of the label image to calculate overlap. Only tested for level 0.

relabeling.title: Relabeling
relabeling.description: If True, relabel the label image to keep unique label across all ROIs

overwrite.title: Overwrite
overwrite.description: If True, overwrite existing label image.

task_list.docs_info:
## init_detect_blob_centroids
Initialized Filter Label by Size task

This task prepares a parallelization list of all zarr_urls that need to be
used to perform Convert Channel to Label task.
## detect_blob_centroids
Detects blob centroids in an intensity image and stores the result as a
label image..

task_list.name: Ashlar Stitching and Registration

zarr_urls.title: Zarr Urls
zarr_urls.description: List of paths or urls to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

zarr_dir.title: Zarr Dir
zarr_dir.description: path of the directory where the new OME-Zarrs will be created. Not used by this task. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

InitArgsAshlarStitchingAndRegistration.description: Arguments to be passed from Ashlar Stitching and Regisrtation init to compute
InitArgsAshlarStitchingAndRegistration.title: InitArgsAshlarStitchingAndRegistration

zarr_url.title: Zarr Url
zarr_url.description: Missing description

overlap.title: Overlap
overlap.description: The overlap between FOVs in percent (0-1).

filter_sigma.title: Filter Sigma
filter_sigma.description: The sigma of the Gaussian filter used to filter the FOVs for stitching. Can help to improve the stitching performance.

ref_wavelength_id.title: Ref Wavelength Id
ref_wavelength_id.description: The wavelength id of the channel to use as reference.

ref_cycle.title: Ref Cycle
ref_cycle.description: The cycle to which the stitched image will be registered to.

overwrite_input.title: Overwrite Input
overwrite_input.description: If `True`, the results of this task will overwrite the input image data. If false, a new image is generated and the stitched data is saved there.

suffix.title: Suffix
suffix.description: What suffix to append to the stitched images. Only relevant if `overwrite_input=False`.

tmp_dir.title: Tmp Dir
tmp_dir.description: Optional path to where the temporary directory should be created. Might be necessary if the default temporary directory (/tmp/) on the cluster has too little space left.

task_list.docs_info:
## init_ashlar_stitching_and_registration
Initializes ashlar stitching and registration task

This task prepares a parallelization list of all zarr_urls that need to be
used to perform ashlar stitching and registration.
## ashlar_stitching_and_registration
Stitches FOVs with overlap using ASHLAR (https://github.com/labsyspharm/ashlar)
and register the stitched image to the reference cycle.

task_list.name: Merge Plate Metadata

zarr_url.title: Zarr Url
zarr_url.description: Path or url to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

feature_table_name.title: Feature Table Name
feature_table_name.description: Name of the feature table to be merged with the metadata.

metadata_path.title: Metadata Path
metadata_path.description: Path to the metadata csv file.

left_on.title: Left On
left_on.description: Column name in the feature table to merge on.

right_on.title: Right On
right_on.description: Column name in the metadata to merge on. If None, it defaults to left_on.

new_feature_table_name.title: New Feature Table Name
new_feature_table_name.description: Name of the new feature table to be created. If None, it defaults to the original feature table name.

task_list.docs_info:
## merge_plate_metadata
Merge a metadata csv file with a Fractal feature table.

Takes a csv file containing metadata and merges it into a Fractal
feature table. The metadata columns will appear in the obs of the
feature table.

task_list.name: Normalize Feature Table

NormalizationLayout.description: Enum for the normalization layout options.
NormalizationLayout.title: NormalizationLayout

zarr_urls.title: Zarr Urls
zarr_urls.description: List of paths or urls to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

zarr_dir.title: Zarr Dir
zarr_dir.description: path of the directory where the new OME-Zarrs will be created. Not used by this task.

condition_column.title: Condition Column
condition_column.description: Name of the column in the feature table that contains the condition information.

control_condition.title: Control Condition
control_condition.description: Name of the control condition to be used for normalization.

feature_table_name.title: Feature Table Name
feature_table_name.description: Name of the feature table that contains the measurements to be normalized.

normalization_layout.title: Normalization Layout
normalization_layout.description: Layout of the normalization. Options are: - full plate: Use all control wells for normalization. - row and column: Use all control wells in the same row and column as the well to be normalized.

additional_control_filters.title: Additional Control Filters
additional_control_filters.description: Dictionary of additional filters to be applied to filter for control conditions. The dictionary should be formatted as: { "column_name": "value",}.

NormalizationMethod.description: Enum for the normalization method options.
NormalizationMethod.title: NormalizationMethod

zarr_url.title: Zarr Url
zarr_url.description: Path or url to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

init_args.title: Init Args
init_args.description: Intialization arguments provided by `init_segment_secondary_objects`. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

normalization_method.title: Normalization Method
normalization_method.description: Method to be used for normalization. Choices are: - z_score: z-score normalization [(X - mean) / std] - robust_z_score: robust z-score normalization [(X - median) / MAD]

log_transform_before_normalization.title: Log Transform Before Normalization
log_transform_before_normalization.description: Whether to log-transform the data before normalization.

output_table_name_suffix.title: Output Table Name Suffix
output_table_name_suffix.description: Suffix to be added to the output table name.

task_list.docs_info:
## init_normalize_feature_table
Initializes normalize feature table task

This task prepares a parallelization list of all zarr_urls that need to be
used to perform measurement normalization.
## normalize_feature_table
Normalize measurements in the feature table with selected method
and the selected control condition.

task_list.name: Correct 4i Bleaching Artifacts

MeanEstimator.description: Enum for the mean estimator options.
MeanEstimator.title: MeanEstimator

zarr_urls.title: Zarr Urls
zarr_urls.description: List of paths or urls to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

zarr_dir.title: Zarr Dir
zarr_dir.description: path of the directory where the new OME-Zarrs will be created. Not used by this task.

condition_column.title: Condition Column
condition_column.description: Name of the column in the feature table that contains the condition information.

control_condition.title: Control Condition
control_condition.description: Name of the condition to be used for correction.

mean_estimator.title: Mean Estimator
mean_estimator.description: Method to be used for estimating the mean of the control population. Choices are: - mean: use arithmetic mean to estimate the control data mean value - median: use median to estimate the control data mean value

feature_table_name.title: Feature Table Name
feature_table_name.description: Name of the feature table that contains the measurements to be corrected.

additional_control_filters.title: Additional Control Filters
additional_control_filters.description: Dictionary of additional metadata filters to be applied to filter. The dictionary should be formatted as: { "column_name": "value",}.

plot_results.title: Plot Results
plot_results.description: Whether to plot the results of the decay model fit.

model_output_dir.title: Model Output Dir
model_output_dir.description: Directory where to save the model parameters and scale factors.

zarr_url.title: Zarr Url
zarr_url.description: Path or url to the individual OME-Zarr image to be processed. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

init_args.title: Init Args
init_args.description: Intialization arguments provided by `init_correct_4i_bleaching_artifacts`. (standard argument for Fractal tasks, managed by Fractal server).

output_table_name_suffix.title: Output Table Name Suffix
output_table_name_suffix.description: Suffix to be added to the output table name.

task_list.docs_info:
## init_correct_4i_bleaching_artifacts
Initializes normalize feature table task

This task prepares a parallelization list of all zarr_urls that need to be
used to perform correction of 4i bleaching artifacts.
## correct_4i_bleaching_artifacts
Correct bleaching aritfacts in the feature table with the selected control
condition. Only intensity features are corrected. Currently, the correction
is applied assuming a zig-zag (starting left-to-right) acquisition pattern.
Other acquisition patterns may be supported in the future.
